p: Beyond the limitations of GCMs, it should also be noted that, like many previous studies ( 3, 4, 17), we do not consider the extratropical transition of storms as they move to higher latitudes. The extratropical transition of TCs that impact the northeastern United States is not uncommon ( 46) and can result in storms such as Hurricane Sandy (2012), which generated devastating surges in NYC as a posttropical cyclone. Sediment records of coastal flooding near NYC support the idea that the frequency of major flood events may be underestimated in GCM studies ( 17).
